ratings.comment: AWFUL, too fast and doesn't speak clearly. Hard to follow. The Homework will take days to complete and every day of the week there is something due. Test are horrible and she doesnt give a good review. WOULD NOT TAKE EVEN IF SHE WAS THE ONLY PROFESSOR IN THE CLASS WOULD RATHER DROP OUT. COMPLETELY AWFUL
Really not too hard, especially if you took Calculus in high school. Very easy to follow lectures and the class is very straight forward. She's also really nice!

Laura was not ideal for a math teacher. She is hard to understand and moves very quickly. Her examples and homework are way easier than the tests, making it extremely difficult to study for tests. I'm lucky i got the grade i did.

Laura is a terrible professor. Lectures are very unorganized and difficult to follow. People stopped going to lecture after two weeks. Teach yourself the material using the book and the exams will be doable. Avoid her.

Professor Villafuerte made Math 213 much harder than it needed to be. The only way I learned was through the textbook. The only thing that made this class bearable was the fact that she game practice exams for the final and midterms so you knew exactly what was going to be on them.
She can hardly speak English. She makes easy math concepts confusing so I stopped going to lecture. Nice lady, but don't take her class.
Worst professor I have ever had. She needs to learn how to say certain math terms in english because otherwise the majority of us can't understand...

Her lectures aren't great, and can be confusing at times. Had an outstanding TA which helped. She posts a "practice exam" a week prior to each exam. The class is an easy A if you do the HW , practice exam, and have a baseline understanding of the concepts

Terrible lectures. Unorganized class structure. I feel like I learned little to nothing while taking this class. She was a nice lady but nearly every other aspect of this class was done poorly. Just studied out of the textbook and did fine.

Very nice, sweet, and funny lady, but not the best teacher. Lectures are sort of confusing if you have never learned the material before, and the TAs need to be relied heavy upon. It is easy to skip class and attend discussions to get a good grade, as long as you do the homework and get help if you need it. Tests aren't overly hard.

Unpredictable. First midterm had 2 questions out of 7 that were not covered in class or discussion at all. How well you do is based on what you already know from previous classes and your TA. Take a different professor for this class if you can.

Her lectures is the most terrible one I've ever had in my life. She doesn't explain what she tries to prove which leaves students in chaos. Tons of mistakes are made every lecture and I think she doesn't even know what she is doing. Definitely not recommended
She basically writes the textbook on the board, and does little to explain it. I am very unhappy with her as a professor.

Laura is a terrific professor who's always willing to put in extra time to help students. While she sometimes struggles to find the right words, she's always caring and can sometimes be pretty funny. Overall, I recommend.

Linear algebra is a tough subject in itself, but Professor Villafuerte was more than willing to put the time in to make sure I understood the concepts. Make sure you understand each chapter before you move on. The chapters build on each other, so if you don't understand one, you won't understand the next.
